name: Infaunal abundance and biomass data from surveys of the East Antrim Maerl bed in 2004
description: This dataset contains information on infaunal abundance and biomass from sediment grabs in Red Bay, Co. Antrim in 2004 on theRV Lough Foyle. The data from this survey was used to help support the SpecialArea of Conservation (SAC) site designation for Red Bay, Co. Antrim. A day grab wasused to collect the samples, in total there were 20 samples taken and analysed. Particle Size Analysis(PSA) and Carbon & Nitrogen analysis was carried out on the sediments from the grab. The presence and absence of Maerl (alive or dead) was also recorded.The most abundant species found was Calcareasp. and the most frequently recorded was the polychaete Glyceralapidium.
